My fingers can‚Äôt longer take the extra ‚Äú-t local‚Äù
üôèüèªüéâüôåüèªüî•üíØü§©üëèüèºüôÄüåÆüèÜ

rebased this & companion to latest master.  
Rechecking PG.  PG4 1155 üëå -- 5 failures, but inspected logs/backtraces and don't believe they are related to the PR.

It might be better to make volume mapping for `db.confdir` configurable as well.
Because we always need to delete existing conf dir.
It will be troublesome in case of repeated local deployment.
@dgrove-oss, pushed a commit that defaults the controllerTidStrides value to controllerInstances if it is not present in the config.
LGTM; thanks

What do you think about moving both controllerInstances and the stride config to `application.conf` and load it via PureConfig? You could then have: `whisk.controller.instanceCount = 1` and `whisk.controller.tidStrides = ${whisk.controller.instanceCount}`?
@csantanapr @houshengbo -- reminder to review
PG3 1542 üîµ
@markusthoemmes, I sent you a message about it. Wouldn't that require updates from the dependent components that @dgrove-oss mentioned?

@rabbah, I like the idea about using nginx to generate the TID. We would probably have to do a fair amount of rewriting though to make it work with the current implementation. How would the invoker TID generation happen with this change?

If the default is in application.conf (instead of in ansible), then the downstream projects don't need to be changed.  They'll get the new defaults automatically.  That's why we're going to migrate as much as possible to using pureconfig.

Invokers don't generate tids, they receive them from the activation messages. They should only have system ids.

The tid generation happens fairly early in the server - we could parse the nginx header at that point and stuff into the tid.

https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/blob/master/common/scala/src/main/scala/whisk/http/BasicHttpService.scala#L103
PG2 2537 üèÉ
PG3 1548 üîµ
PG2 2357 üîµ
Thanks - tweaked the doc.

Proposed patch in #3105 adds `-e mode=HA` to the setup playbook to deploy multiple instances. Otherwise only one instance of the core components is deployed. This works with `redo` as well: `-a "-e mode=HA"`.
This was an error on my end filling my VM.

@csantanapr have you had a chance to review this?
@jonpspri i apologize i think my merge created conflicts for you - I will try to resolve them for you.
No worries.  I can look later today, too.  This is a no-big-deal set of updates ‚Äî just adding lessons learned to the docs.

I found the [detailed tutorial for Vagrant](https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/blob/master/tools/vagrant/README.md), I suppose I have to:

```
vagrant ssh
cd ${ANSIBLE_HOME}
# teardown all containers expect couchdb container
ansible-playbook -i environments/local openwhisk.yml -e mode=clean
# deploy openwhisk containers
ansible-playbook -i environments/local openwhisk.yml
```
to re-deploy after VM restart.
PG1 2472 üèÉ
PG1 2472 üÜó - 6 test failures but ones that also happened on recent runs without this change.
Let's move past this for now.  I'll take another run through the configuration on my Docker for Mac when I get the chance and re-post updates as I see them.
PG3/1563 üîµ
@mdeuser @csantanapr can you review?
This works for me on docker for mac. Thanks @ddragosd!
@csantanapr can you merge this?
@tysonnorris is this useful for you also? do you want to revive your pr or shall we consolidate with this one?
PG3/1564 üîµ
closed in favor of cleaner #3129
Hum I need some bit of time to take a look at other images we use internally that we extend from common/scala image, that are failing when I tried this PR in our internal pipeline.
Closing to rebase and file a PR from a new branch.

Thanks for rebasing;  at first glance this looks reasonable to me.  Take a look at the pending change to add a remote_redirect mode for the CLI (#3100) too;  I think it should be fine with the changes you are proposing.
PG2 2556 üîµ
The source moved to this repo https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk-runtime-docker/blob/master/core/actionProxy/actionproxy.py

Travis failed due to the following error which seems to have nothing to do with this patch.
How can we restart the Travis?

whisk.core.controller.test.ActivationsApiTests > Activations API should get summary activation by namespace and action name FAILED
    org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: 2 was not equal to 0
        at org.scalatest.MatchersHelper$.indicateFailure(MatchersHelper.scala:340)
        at org.scalatest.Matchers$ShouldMethodHelper$.shouldMatcher(Matchers.scala:6668)

----
Let me rebase the patch to start the travis ci again.
And it seems I shouldn't have updated the patch with --amend.
updated Jan 9, 2018
Thanks! I got it.

Thinking about this change more over break, it seems to me that it would be cleaner to not conflate local building vs. downloading of the CLU and embedding the CLI in the edge host vs. putting a redirect in the nginx.conf file.   So instead of having 3 modes for cli_installation_mode we would have two boolean properties: cli_build_locally (default to false) and cli_download_redirect (default to true).    Thoughts?

Default volume mapping for `db_confdir` is removed.
So there is no volume mapping for CouchDB by default.

And `cookie` is introduced.
Though one of CouchDB nodes is restarted, they will form a cluster.
https://github.com/apache/couchdb/blob/master/rel/overlay/etc/vm.args#L34

One thing to discuss is, default security mode of CouchDB is `admin_local`.
So anyone can read/write against `5984` port.
How about changing this to `admin_only`?
Then only admin can read/write CouchDB.
Travis status is green.

An activation once pulled from the kafka bus in an invoker may be lost (or executed but an activation record lost) if an invoker fails, or the connection to couch fails. The execution of an action is best effort, at most once.

The idea of having invoker pools for blocking vs non-blocking requests has been discussed in the past. There‚Äôs an ongoing work thread to modify the load balancing to allow work redistribution which is difficult to do today. Once in place - along with a fairness policy - it should be easier to have different pools scheduled. 

If you want to do it today, you can follow the model used to segerate docker actions from other actions in the load balancer.
@rabbah what is "docker actions"?
When you create an action with `wsk action create --docker`

I was heading in the same direction.  My intention was to have build occur in the 'incubator-openwhisk-cli' project.  The build would actually create two artifacts:

1. The `wsk` binaries (as it does today).

1. A tarball for deployment in Nginx consisting of the binaries directory structure _and_ the `content.json` file.

Riffing on that, the CLI "download" could pull the tarball from a URL, and for local build the configuration could override that URL with `file://../../incubator-openwhisk-cli/build/<path-to-tarball>.tgz`.  So we only need to address the two Nginx configurations (download vs redirect) -- anyone wanting local build should be savvy enough to do the build themselves before overriding the URL.  Local CLI sourcing is similar -- is a URL override provided?  Get that.  Otherwise, get the 'default' CLI for the local OS and architecture from the github release page.  @csantanapr @rabbah @houshengbo
This error doesn't discriminate enough - a total failure to fetch will result in the new misleading error now.

I opened PR it on behalf of @sungjunyoung.  #3138 
cc. @rabbah

@vvraskin any idea which triggers this situation? In theory it should **never** be happening (or at least that's the assumption in the code).

Is there some other bug to fix to prevent this from happening?

We need to be wary here (and/or rethink our strategies) that in an HA setup, these values are subject to eventual consistency and as such might not be helpful for the user (depending on the use-case she is trying to implement).
@markusthoemmes the bug is addressed by #3132.
@dubeejw @markusthoemmes thanks for the review, I squashed the commits.
proposed https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/pull/3139 to address error message.

Okay.  Let me see if I can get a CLI-changes-only PR together.  Please review my responses to your other reactions and let me know your thoughts after.  I can then start on the needed cleanup.  I need to eat now... no one codes well on an empty stomach.
Created #3145 with the CLI changes.  Will re-baseline this PR once #3145 is checked out and merged.
PG3 1598 üîµ
Demonstration of `expireAfterWrite` policy while continuously invoking the same action: Continuous invocation of the same action with `expireAfterAccess`:

@csantanapr @cbickel 
Could you guys review this please?

+1 to making the policy configurable per cache. 
Having a source to invalidate identities would be nice (part of a general admin api perhaps) but requires both work here and integration with the iam source.
@csantanapr -- ping
Thanks @markusthoemmes, didn't think about the `Identity` cache.
@tysonnorris , @ddragosd FYI
See https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/blob/master/docs/dev/configuration.md
thanks @rabbah . I will update it to pure config.

:+1: LGTM w @rabbah‚Äôs comments.

Would it benefit OW operators more if these limits would be associated with each ‚Äúkind‚Äù in the  runtime_manifest ? If yes, we can consider adding another PR after this one.

Do you envision having different memory spreads per kind?
I like the idea of putting this in the runtime manifest though regardless.
Just rebased to apache:master to ease the next phases of the conversation.

Pushed changes that allow the cache invalidation policy to be configured based on access time or write time. Where the access time is the default and the `Identity` cache uses the write time policy. 

Also made the `cache` definition lazy, which will presumably prevent the cache from needlessly being instantiated if `fromCache` is set to `false`.

I thought about it - they share the same underlying method, so I thought it's sufficient.
We should probably refactor these API tests so that there's a base common set that we can iterate over all the collections rather than clone and own the tests in each. Already there's a bunch of duplication.
@markusthoemmes, can you take another look?

üîµ PG2:2583
PG2 2591 üèÉ

@dgrove-oss afaics the tests are failing because those pureconfig values are not set in test setup. Do you have any pointer for setting them in tests?
(just asking as you're making the same pureconfig changes in ddoc :) )

This has been [an issue for me again in another project](https://github.com/jthomas/cloud-functions-metrics-service/issues/1) which needs to retrieve all activations since a timestamp. The only solution is to loop through retrieving activations using `skip` parameter until the result set is empty. 

Looking at the issues, other people are encountering this too https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/issues/3051
PG2 2589 üîµ

I think the problem is that you didn't add the default values to application.conf.   You need to add them in the "whisk" stanza that starts here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/blob/29273808b43fcdf1e2479d8f6b58c3daf1da5c04/common/scala/src/main/resources/application.conf#L52.

Also, your defaults should be default() instead of default("somevalue") so that it loads the default from application.conf
PG2 2591 üëå -- 1 test failure that can't be due to this change.
